intro: Lunathyrium jiulungense, commonly known as the Jiulung mountain bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and erect. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
